intro: Delphinium virescens subsp. wootonii, commonly known as the Wooton's larkspur, is a herbaceous perennial native to the western United States. It features tall, sparsely branched stems that bear clusters of sky-blue to violet flowers. The plant has lance-shaped, hairy leaves that are arranged alternately along the stem. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun to partial shade. Its botanical characteristics make it a distinctive and ornamental addition to alpine and meadow gardens.
